pr_title: GEODE-8004: Fix for regression introduced by GEODE-7565

timeline.bodyText: The above fields are not used anywhere, can we just remove them?, or am I missing something?.
timeline.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: You are right, it seems they are not used, I will remove them.
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: These operations can be directly executed within the PingOpImpl constructor, as we do with the rest of the messages. I've also noted that you changed the clearMessage flag from false to true as well, any reasons behind that?.
timeline.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: Im afraid I dont have a reason to explain that change. I used a draft from @bschuchardt when implementing this, and I didnt realize about it. Bruce, could you help with this please?
replies.author: alb3rtobr

replies.bodyText:
Ops that configure their message in constructors use AbstractOp.sendMessage().  This class already overrode that method so there's no reason to configure the message in the constructor.  That could be done though - is it a problem?
Maybe we don't have to clear the message in Message.send(boolean) but the default implementation, Message.send(), does this and since we've introduced a Part to this message I thought it prudent to clear it.
replies.author: bschuchardt

replies.bodyText: No problem at all, I was just checking as I saw other messages execute the entire configuration logic (set number of parts, adding parts, etc.) directly in the constructor.
replies.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: thanks @bschuchardt
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to expose the MemberIdentifier here, you can directly use InternalDistributedMember.compareTo(DistributedMember o, boolean compareMemberData, boolean compareViewIds), which internally delegates to the MemberIdentifier class.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText:
The issue described here still remains, you're comparing myID (instance of InternalDistributedMember) against targetServer.getMemberIdentifier() (instance of MemberIdentifier), so the comparison fails with a ClassCastException and the client logs the following:
[warn 2020/04/24 01:33:02.869 PDT <poolTimer-edgeDescript-29> tid=0x112] Pool unexpected java.lang.ClassCastException: [B cannot be cast to java.lang.Throwable connection=Pooled Connection to rs-GEM-2885-0120a0i32xlarge-hydra-client-4:20245: Connection[DESTROYED]). Server unreachable: could not connect after 1 attempts
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: @jujoramos Implementing tests I realized this writeReply here is duplicated, pingCorrectServer is already calling it when the ping is forwarded. So this should be the cause for the error you saw about an unexpected REPLY message.
timeline.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: This entire class has several modifications and new non-trivial methods, we should add tests to verify the correct behaviour.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: Unnecessary empty line here.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: This is a new class, unit and distribution tests are required.
timeline.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: Do you think its enough with the distributed tests added? I think the class so simple that there is nothing I could test with unit test that is not already tested by the distributed tests.
replies.author: alb3rtobr

replies.bodyText:
Hey @alb3rtobr
Agreed, the class itself is pretty simple... Having extra unit tests is harmless (and beneficial), however, so I'd say go ahead and add them, it shouldn't take long :-).
replies.author: jujoramos

timeline.message:
Revert "Revert "GEODE-7565: Allow gateway receivers with same host and port (#4824)" (#4974)"

This reverts commit e1c17e16fd28174b37a5426b30d729a94d6766a3.
Change returned message type from REPLY to EXCEPTION
Use views info to compare servers in ping
Dont forward ping if target server view is different
More fixes and distributed tests for ping
Dont use empty member IDs in LocatorLoadSnapshot UT
Dont use empty member IDs in LocatorLoadSnapshotIntegrationTest
Dont use empty member IDs in LocatorLoadSnapshotIntegrationTest

timeline.bodyText: The exception is not thrown anywhere in the method, it can be removed.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: The exception is not thrown anywhere in the method, it can be removed.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: The exceptions are not thrown anywhere in the method, they can be removed.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure it is entirely correct to override the procesAck method... Looking through the source code, there's only one operation overriding this (TXSynchronizationOp) and it ends up delegating to the super class method whenever the exception is not the one it knows how to handle. There's also a comment regarding c++ clients in AbstractOp.processAck(), we should be careful not to break those clients as well.
@bschuchardt: thoughts on this one?.
timeline.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: This method is not necessary. I started with a different method, but at the end, its doing the same as AbstractOp.processAck(), I will remove it.
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: Can these two fields be declared as final?.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: Should we use getMemberId().getUniqueId() here instead of just getMemberId(), as that's what we are using to calculate the hashCode?.
timeline.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: Good catch!
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: No need to use format as we are not using parameters, just concatenating String objects.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText: Tests could be improved to also assert that the receivedPing method from the ClientHealthMonitor class has been invoked when required. Just a suggestion, anyways.
timeline.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: Im not sure if it can be done. The ClientHealthMonitor object is obtained using a static method, which cannot be mocked.
replies.author: alb3rtobr

replies.bodyText:
Agreed, but you could easily move the whole logic about getting ClientHealthMonitor and updating the ping received to an extra method, which can be mocked and/or spied.
Another option would be to move the retrieval of the ClientHealthMonitor class to an extra method and mock that method to return your own spied ClientHealthMonitor, which can be checked afterwards.
replies.author: jujoramos

replies.bodyText: done!
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: This constructor doesn't seem to be used anywhere, so we could just delete it.
timeline.author: jujoramos

timeline.bodyText:
This is a new method and should be, at leat, unit tested.
You can make it package private, annotate it with @VisibleForTesting and access it directly from LocatorLoadSnapshotJUnitTest and/or LocatorLoadSnapshotIntegrationTest.

timeline.bodyText: There is a null check for memberId in hashCode() but not in equals().  If it's possible for memberId to be null then you should add a null check to equals().
timeline.author: bschuchardt

replies.bodyText: Fixed, thanks!
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: This pair of equals()/hashCode() methods has the same problem.
